results.title: A Filmmaker's Journey
results.brief_description: Superlative documentary tracing the career if one of Hollywood’s most acclaimed and ambitious directors, George Stevens. Unlike other similar documentaries, this is not a mere star studded exercise in hero worship; a real sense of the director’s personality emerges. Excerpts from many of his films are used, including “Giant”, “Shane”, “Gunga Din”, and “The Diary of Anne Frank”. This tribute was written and directed by Stevens’ son.

results.title: A Film for projection
results.brief_description: A short film with narration showing all the do’s and dont’s of film projection and film handling. Written by John Thompson, edited by Norman l. Ziegler, photographed by George D. Hobbs and narrated by Charles Cousens.

results.title: A Film about film making
results.creator_credit: Henry Cheharbakshi and International Film Bureau Inc
results.brief_description: An explanation about how a group of people make a film. From the idea, we see the process of choosing cast and crew, writing of the synopsis giving setting, characters of the story, clothes, props and action. The formation of a shooting script is seen, and planning of action. Finally the film is shot, edited and shown.

results.title: A Fight for breath: emphysema
results.creator_credit: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film aimed at youngsters tempted by cigarettes but also for all those already addicted. Why a man suffering from emphysema has difficulty breathing is graphically illustrated. The entire respiratory system is shown in animated cross-sectional models, down to the smallest air cells, the alveoli. That is where the breakdown begins that eventually leads to impaired pulmonary function. This internal view of the damage done to the lungs is one that no viewer can ignore.

results.title: A Figgy Duff Christmas
results.creator_credit: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: For hundreds of years, Newfoundlanders have been celebrating Christmas, developing distinct traditions. One of these is figgy duff pudding. A musical group, named after the traditional dessert, play and sing the old songs sung at that time of the year.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Gough, Rex Tasker, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Field in Asia
results.creator_credit: Jehangir Bhownagary, George Wickremesinghe, United Nations and Ceylon Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Agricultural extension officers of F.A.O. encourage Asian farmers to use better methods to increase harvests. An example in Ceylon shows use of better seed and improved sowing, cultivating and fertilising. Original music by Ravi Shankar.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jehangir Bhownagary, George Wickremesinghe, United Nations and Ceylon Government Film Unit

results.title: A Few things I know about her
results.brief_description: Six short films which look at issues of femininity, body image, gender roles and which celebrate aspects of being a woman. A fascinating insight into what makes women tick.

results.title: A Few good men
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman, David Brown, Castle Rock Entertainment and Columbia
results.brief_description: A young Marine is brutalised by two fellow Marines at the United States Navy Base in Cuba. The bashing ends in the young Marine’s death. It looks like a simple case but a methodical US Navy lawyer (Demi Moore) is keen to investigate the killing, convinced that the bashing was a result of a “Code Red”, an unofficial system of bastardry which aims to convert the young marines into effective fighting machines. “A Few Good Men” is a detective story, a film about responsibility and conduct, and it features some powerful and adrenalin-pumping courtroom drama. Tom Cruise is suitably boyish and charming as a maverick Navy lawyer and Jack Nicholson is outstanding as a US General arrogantly convinced of his superiority and power.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman, David Brown, Castle Rock Entertainment and Columbia

results.title: A Festival of nine lessons and carols; King's College Choir
results.brief_description: Filmed in the chapel of King’s College, Cambridge, the world famous King’s College Choir perform the traditional Christmas festival of nine lessons and carols. The carols include all of the standard favourites, such as “Once in Royal David’s city”, “O little town of Bethlehem”, “We three kings of orient are” and “O come all ye faithful”. The second half of the video is a documentary which shows the lives of the choristers and scholars in the school, some performances and their preparations for the Christmas festival as well as explaining the history of the school and the chapel. The Choir is directed by Stephen Cleobury.

results.title: A Feeling of self worth
results.brief_description: A feeling of self worth describes the approach taken at Monterey and the positive impact this has had on the school. Present and former staff and the parents of former students talk about the school as it used to be and the improvements that have been made
